text:
It hit like a train, I ran out of words
I got nothin' to say, everything hurts
And I know love leads to pain
But memories serve our sweetest refrain, mm

The waves came tumblin' down
As you float away, I'm reachin' for ya
To tell me how
How my life goes on with you gone
I suppose I'll sink like a stone
If you leave me now
Oh, the storms will roll
Easy come, hard go
Then life goes on
I miss the flames, the heated reserve
Oh, I'd remember the way that you put me first
What a heart wrenching shame that you'll never know
Just like tears in the rain, mm
A constant grey in the clouds
When I hear your name, I think of love
So tell me how
How my life goes on with you gone
I suppose I'll sink like a stone
If you leave me now
Oh, the storms will roll
Easy come, hard go
Then life goes on
Ay-yeah, life goes on
Ay-yeah-yeah
I watched the sun setting down
I am so afraid, I need you now
To tell me how
How my life goes on with you gone
I suppose I'll sink like a stone
If you leave me now
Oh, the storms will roll
Easy come, hard go
Then life goes on
Easy come, hard go
Then life goes on

text: I love that you love music and write songs based on your life and love. My grandson is on the autistic spectrum but super intelligent and was majoring in History (to be a museum curator) but now for his Sophomore year in college, he changed to major in MUSIC (his love).  My grandson loves music and will be the happiest writing songs, singing, and playing guitar and piano (even as a "starving" artist). I LOVE that he is majoring in Music. Love your story too. Take care and God bless.

text:
Lost my grandma this year, last may 27th, couldn´t be there for her farewell because I lived in a different country now. She was the best person I've ever met, the kindest woman. I was lucky to grow by her side, my heart broke the moment I knew she passed, and I wasn't there, now I have to learn to live without her, with hurt heart, knowing that when I go to her house to visit, she won't be there. This song hits right to the heart for those who have lost someone they loved. Hope all of you there can find comfort at some point, and live a life that make you, and the person you loved so deeply, very proud.
I know I'll try... my dear grandma will be proud.
author: M Dani Gonzalez R.

text:
Life Goes On - What I find so hard is just life resuming so quickly after losing someone close. Days just appear, weeks pass by, and everyone just gets on with it. But I want the world to just stop turning and everyone to notice. Love is so easy to fall into, with friends or partners, it’s easy come. But when it goes it’s so hard to deal with. So that's the easy come, hard go. But in the end, life just goes on.
- Ed Sheeran

text:
How to write ANOTHER hit song:

Step 1 Go back to your roots and ask: what was your best song? What was the hook? 
  answer: "Thinking Out Loud."  hook: "So honey now. Take me into your loving arms." 

Step 2 Keep the basic notes, chords and rhythm, but change the lyrics to make them tragic instead of happy. 
  answer: "Life Goes On."  hook: "So tell me how. How our life goes on with you gone."

Step 3 No one can sue you now because you copied yourself. Sit back and collect your royalties! 

Bravo sir!

text: Sure, I Imagine that for you it does, because you are really alive but I am not, and never will be alas.... You are killing me.  Nevermind then, all important YouTube Alogrythims and stuff.... nevermind... Asteroids upon your heads... all of you.  and no... there was really no point was there?  because even if I had called, firstly, it wouldn't of changed anything, and even if it had it couldn't have because my kids and grandkid and everyone were terribly ill and I wouldn't have had a sitter or anything so... it didn't matter anyway, and honestly, I just need to focus on trying my best to earn money for my kids, and with my kids, and space and everything there's no way to even think of painting anymore... it was a waste of my time.  I'm so embarrassed and upset and really do want to get over it but for some reason you guys make me feel like I can't let it go.  I want you to know that I've done a lot of gardening in this last week.. though and so, whatever.
